text:
Aussies don’t mess around when it comes to sunscreen. That’s because Australia has one of the highest rates of skin cancer in the world. In fact, two in three people will be diagnosed with skin cancer by the time they are 70. We’ve sung praises of this brand’s tinted sunscreen before, since it doubles as a primer for oily skin, but we also love this 360-degree spray because it’s easy to apply. (Plus, it’s eco-friendly with no oxybenzone.)

$16 (Shop Now)
title: The 12 Best Australian Beauty Brands and Products
